paper.title: Implementation of Quantum Annealing: A Systematic Review
paper.abstract: Quantum annealing is a quantum computing approach widely used for optimization and probabilistic sampling problems. It is an alternative approach designed due to the limitations of gate-based quantum computing models. The method is observed to have a significant impact on different fields such as machine learning, graphics, routing, scheduling, computational chemistry, computational biology, security, portfolio, and others despite the fact that it is relatively new. This research provides a systematic review of research development trends in the field of quantum annealing and analyzes how it has been implemented in different problem domains. The results are expected to serve as the basis to identify the opportunities and challenges of research related to its implementation. The main contribution of this systematic review is to summarize different implementations of quantum annealing. It is also to analyze the prospect and opportunities in one of the problem domains with the greatest interest which is machine learning.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要对量子退火技术在不同问题领域的实现进行了系统性综述，虽然提到了投资组合（portfolio）作为其中一个应用领域，但并未深入探讨其在投资组合管理中的具体应用或研究。论文的核心焦点是量子退火技术的通用实现和其在机器学习中的前景，而非特定的金融研究领域。
